title: Redundant closure works, but fn item doesn't
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code [[Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=de57999cc0ff59a10c1932482811bfc0)]:

```rust
fn fn_item<'a>(values: impl Iterator<Item = Option<&'a u32>> + 'a) -> impl Iterator<Item = Option<u32>> + 'a {
    values.map(Option::copied)
}

fn closure<'a>(values: impl Iterator<Item = Option<&'a u32>> + 'a) -> impl Iterator<Item = Option<u32>> + 'a {
    values.map(|o| o.copied())
}
```

I expected to see this happen:

Both should compile, because the compiler should have the same information in both cases.

Instead, this happened: 

```
error[[E0034]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/stable/error-index.html#E0034): multiple applicable items in scope
 --> src/lib.rs:2:24
  |
2 |     values.map(Option::copied)
  |                        ^^^^^^ multiple `copied` found
  |
  = note: candidate #1 is defined in an impl for the type `Option<&T>`
  = note: candidate #2 is defined in an impl for the type `Option<&mut T>`
```

### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

(nightly, and stable)

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.65.0-nightly (fa6ee9375 2022-09-12)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: fa6ee9375242ae784dab1837dfc0b92f43e787ce
commit-date: 2022-09-12
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.65.0-nightly
LLVM version: 15.0.0
```
